instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3662: What is 820-3662? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video on internal display
threads.message:
I've got this <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that shows no video on the internal display. i get 0v on L8300 so i checked back at <CHIP>U8300</CHIP> and have 0v on pin 1 which is the power on pin for <CHIP>U8300</CHIP>. i get 0v on <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCD</SIGNAL>/BKL/T. I don't think this machine is seeing the lcd but not getting voltage on <CHIP>U8300</CHIP> is making me think of <CHIP>U1100</CHIP> not working properly.
i did reset the PRAM and smc

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video on internal display
threads.message: External video present? Tested with known good LCD?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video on internal display
threads.message: yes it has external video. the screen I'm using is from a working machine. i did test continuity on the connector threw a good cable also, so don't think its a connector issue.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video on internal display
threads.message: All the caps present in the eDP lines? <CAPACITOR>C8320</CAPACITOR> and up, also check the coils FL8300 and up.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video on internal display
threads.message: yes all caps are present <CAPACITOR>C8320</CAPACITOR>,<CAPACITOR>C8321</CAPACITOR>,<CAPACITOR>C8322</CAPACITOR>,<CAPACITOR>C8323</CAPACITOR>,<CAPACITOR>C8324</CAPACITOR>,<CAPACITOR>C8325</CAPACITOR>,<CAPACITOR>C8326</CAPACITOR>,<CAPACITOR>C8327</CAPACITOR>. all of the coils, fl8300,fl8301,fl8302, fl8303 are present and have continuity. i beginning to wonder if my test screen shit the bed. i tested all pins for short to ground with screen plugged in and only had ground on the pins that its supposed to be on, i did have 0L on all the data lines though. not sure if that is supposed to be correct?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video on internal display
threads.message:
If you do not know your test LCD is good then I cannot help further. First thing is to have a 100% known good part for testing.
Do check if there is a short burst of power on L8300 right on start up.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video on internal display
threads.message: ok, back to this one for me. i did get a known good tested screen for it and still same issue. it does have a short burst of 2.9v on l8300 then goes back down to 0.0v. not sure what this means. maybe a bad cap in the line?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video on internal display
threads.message: Run ASD and see if there is a symbol error when it tests the LCD. Inspect caps/connector and <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video on internal display
threads.message:
i was able to run ASD and yes it had a symbol error( but i didn't have a screen connected) <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> area seems just fine looking. it also failed for 6 other issues also. the one i was thinking is not correct is 
sensor- current (IO5R) 5V Rail Highside --- sensor reads below the low limit.

when i tested for voltage at pin 6 of <CHIP>U5420</CHIP> i got 0.040v. i did get 3v on pin3, and 12.5v on pins 4-5. i also check the resistors and they check out just fine. I'm thinking maybe <CHIP>U5420</CHIP> is screwed up?

 the next 3 were battery temp test( again not plugged in)
the next 2 were ssd temp test( again no plugged in) but strange

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video on internal display
threads.message: So you tested without LCD connected......what good does that do? As for the sensor issue it's reading low cause there is no LCD puling current on the 5V bus.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video on internal display
threads.message:
Shit wasn't thinking on that one. i retested with everything plugged in. ASD OS fails for 
 sensor group test- limit load test. error -1 unknown error 
 ASD EFI fails for 
display port symbol error test - error- Lane count is zero
sensor temperature (th0a) -- SSD A sensor is reading below low limit
sensor temperature (th0b) -- SSD B sensor is reading below low limit

these seem strange because i i used the thunderbolt ports to run ASD on external

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video on internal display
threads.message: Bad connector? Measure continuity from a separate LCD cable the the caps/coils. Also do a diode mode test on the eDP caps on the CPU side to check for continuity to the CPU.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video on internal display
threads.message: I went ahead and replace the connector and check for continuity like you said and everything was fine there. I did diode mode test on <RESISTOR>R0530</RESISTOR> pin 1 reads out as 0.015v pin 2 0.030v. also noticed that i do get a pulse of 5v on L3800 then back to 0.0v. Not really sure whats going on with this board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video on internal display
threads.message: Only thing that is left is a CPU issue I'm afraid. Last thing to check is voltages in <RESISTOR>R0531</RESISTOR> and diode mode.
